insight: ChatControl's Discord integration requires the DiscordSRV plugin. Users must disable DiscordSRV's built-in chat relay by setting `DiscordChatChannelMinecraftToDiscord: false` in DiscordSRV's `config.yml`, otherwise messages get duplicated. ChatControl checks this on startup and logs a warning if it's still enabled (see ChatControl.java line ~247).

`/ch sendas <player> <channel> <message>` requires the target player to be online. The entire channel message pipeline (formats, placeholders, permissions, range, rules) depends on a live player session. For web panel / automation use cases where the player may be offline, alternatives are `/chc announce <channel> <message>` (console broadcast) or `/mail send <player> <message>` (offline delivery).
